intro: Moquilea kallunkiae, commonly known as the Andean mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to the cold, harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often trailing or climbing. Moquilea kallunkiae is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
